rComments: Baldo is hilarious and certainly knows his material. Lectures were both fun and very informative. Textbook readings are nonexistant and there's no homework, but the tests are no joke. Tests are all short answer, and you'll have to basically memorize everything you learn in the class. Sometimes tests are hard to understand so study the practice exam

Baldo is awesome. He is hilarious, inspiratonal and very willing to talk to students. He'said focused on teaching not research. You don't need to read the textbook but he doesnt post lectures online, so u NEED to be in lecture. Flashcards and definitions are best way to study (plus practice exam & quizlet). His exams and grading are very fair

Go to lecture and study a whole lot before tests and you may get a B. Tests were wordy free response questions. And it usually wasn't clear what they were asking for. Hardest part of this class was figuring out what the professor was thinking while writing his confusing tests.

Baldo is crazy in all the best ways and maybe a few of the less-good ways. He's mostly energetic and clear in class; tests are unique and fairly difficult and require thorough studying.  He doesn't post lectures online, so missing a lecture can bring you down.  The material is mostly really easy. I didn't use a textbook at all.

He does not post his lecture notes online so you need to go to class to get the information you need for his exams. All the information he gives you, you will be tested on. Take good notes and that will be your textbook. It's a really interesting class and you will get an A if you commit his lectures to memory.

I loved Baldo! He is very devoted to his teaching and gives clear examples for every concept. He is also really funny and helps you remember the material. The tests are pretty tricky , but if you study old exams and know definitions you'll be fine.

Baldo is awesome. He is funny and conveys material really well. His test aren't easy but if you study  for comprehension you will be fine; he asks lots of concept questions. All around awesome professor, inspired me to change majors.

Really solid professor. The only thing I didn't like is that he doesn't post his lectures so it makes you go to class every day which is good I guess. His tests are like worksheets, no multiple choice all short answer written questions but they're really fair if you study. Very fair class don't be afraid to take it with him.

Baldo is a great professor! Literally memorize and be ready to apply what you learn in class as his tests cover pretty much everything you learned (even the seemingly unimportant points). Take the examples he gives you during class seriously as they can show up on the exams. Do not skip class because lectures aren't posted.
The class overall requires a lot of memorization. The tests are pretty difficult and I think that's what killed me and my grade. Although, the professor's very funny.

Boldo is awesome, he is truely passionate about the subject and it shows. This class is very demeanding and the lab practicals are brutal. Be prepared to dedicate most of your study time to this class and you will have a great time. Boldo actually comes to all the labs along with your TA, sooo helpful! This is a must take class
Easy concepts. I barely studied for the class.
a really great teacher, and lecturer

Great teacher who's passionate about the topic and wants his students to succeed. No hw but frequent section quizzes. Tests are all short answer but not long. They aren't impossible but you need to study lecture notes and the format separates the A students from the B and C students. You learn how to study for his tests after the first midterm.

Bioe 20c with him is fun, interesting, and easy.  No hw or section, he posts old exams online, and everything you need is in the lecture. If you need help, a quick google search will do. The lecture is prepared and includes helpful visuals you can find in the book but you can find similar picture online.

Classes can be a little boring sometime but it's important to know what you're doing. Notes are essential as he doesn't post them online or anything. Attention to detail is needed, tests can be tricky but study hard from past exams and go over terms and history. He's also pretty funny; reminds me of Mermaid Man. Quizzes happen often
Baldo is Baldo. He's fair. Just study lecture notes.
This class was not easy for me, but the material was super interesting. Baldo is a great teacher, but be prepared to study a lot.

This was my second class with Baldo, and it was another great experience! Baldo knows so much about inverts and I really enjoyed and learned a lot in this class. Yes, the material is difficult, but Baldo doesn't try and "trick" you on tests. Very helpful, straightforward, entertaining, and knowledgeable professor! Wish he taught more classes!!!

If you want to do well you have to attend the lectures and take notes. He is very entertaining and gives enjoyable lectures. For the exams, memorize the terms, understand their concepts, and be able to apply them to scenarios.

While Baldo is a nice and fun person, he is not the best teacher. His lectures are not organized in a way that makes note-taking fluid (it jumps around quite a bit). His tests were all short answer and required more time than the period allowed. He never gave any idea how well you did on the tests (just a #, not even showing total possible points).

Good professor. He made class interesting even though it was an eight am class. Tests were fair, but I don't know about the grading. I emailed about my final grade, he took weeks to reply. Then I asked where to pick it up and if he could please recheck my grade, and he never replied, :o

Baldo is amazing! His class was awesome. My only regret was I took it over the summer so I only had 5 weeks with him. Bio 20C was fun anyway but Baldo made it better he was always well prepared and  would make subtle jokes throughout class. I thought he was great and if I ever get the chance to take his class again, I would.
Great teacher! He definitely makes Biology more interesting. It's a lot of memorization, but the class is really fun. I highly recommend it for Bio majors. Great review.

Easy to understand, but you better pay attention if you want to keep up.  Keeps class lively with subtle jokes and a distinctive roundabout way of describing simple things.  Baldo likes the students, and is easy to approach.  He also seems to know almost everything about everything, and is glad to share.

Baldo is great!  Hilarious, awesome interesting lectures even if the subject isn't your thing, cares about students, knows everything about invertebrates!  Tough class though and he sometimes talks too fast in leactures.

Best professor I have had yet.  Funny, and truely interested in the subject material.  The guy also seems to know everything! However, the tests were very hard.  Even though lectures were not required, I don't think its possible to do well in this class without going.

Not that great of a professor. He goes over what is on the test, end of story. He does the required amount of work and that's it. He is average. The one good quality is that he is easy to talk to. Aside from that he is nothing special. If another teacher taught the class, I would probably take it. He's not horrible, but he's not spectacular either.

He's great! even for an 8am class, i had no problem staying awake. he's good at explaining things, and although theres a lot of material and the tests were only ten questions, the average grade was an 89, and he offers 15 points extra credit. Super easy class. go to lecture and you dont need to read.

Cool guy, but the multiple choice tests are so easy its hard, ended up with a B-! Go to class and you won't have to touch your book, and you'll get to hear priceless student questions like, "Why would a species WANT to evolve?"
No Comments

Baldo is a great professor, very enthusiastic, very informative, and very entertaining. He knows his stuff and how to relate it to people who don't always care. Multiple choice test easy, if confusing. In section quizzes kept you studying and prepared. Great class, hope to take Inverts with him soon.

I had him for the summer for 20c. Very clear. I really liked him, but he assumed that everyone took 20a first, so there were a couple of things that got me, but just a few, and it got me ahead in 20a when I took it in the fall.

Baldo is pleasant, funny, and approachable. I've never seen him mad. However, he's not that great of a teacher, the TA's did a better job of clarifying the material. You have to pass 3 of the 4 tests in order to pass the class, and I thought I did, but I still got a D in the class. The tests were confusing. Homework was tedious.

Baldo is awesome.  very approachable and takes time to answer questions after class.  It was an intro class, so it was pretty easy.  The book is optional, but read it after lecture so you know what to focus on. I got a 94% on all 4 Tests. They are easy but multiple guess so he will try to get you with tricky questions. class very entertaining so go

Tests are straight foward and he's clear on what it covers.  Just read the book, even though it's a pain when you have to filter out what he's going to test you on.  It's an intro class so it's really really basic.  You can't just rely on the notes he gives, you have to look it up in the book!  I recommend this class- easy A for bio majors.

This class was an easy A! However, Baldo was not always as clear as he should have been on exams. Somehow about half the class failed the first exam??? (I got a B without studying) He ended up "curving" the class. He assigns mandatory homework and I would recommend going to lecture. Section wasn't mandatory unless you failed the 1st exam.

He is not a good professor at all! I expect more from him since he's teaching at a UC campus. He's test are easy yet confusing! It's always a 50 question muliple choice test & he always makes a mistake in writing them. He makes no sense at all. I did not enjoy the class. It was a waste of time. He needs to be a better professor & make better exams!

Friendly professor, very difficult tests. Expects a ton of detail in short answer questions. Talks a bit too fast so you can't write everything down and he doesn't put it all on the board. Has a tendency to block the board so can't see what he has written. Hardest Bio class I've taken. Learned a lot, but make sure class is for you before signing up
want an A? don't take this class unless you are good at listening to details and taking multiple choice tests.

He is really knowledgeable professor, but gives difficult tests. You must go to class to get his notes. Memorize/know/understand all of his notes for his tests. Even practice writing out the concepts and understand how to interpret the information. His tests are all written, so be super prepared to analyze/interpret/define everything.
Great professor! He knows his stuff. I would definitely recommend taking a course taught by him. Just remember to attend EVERY lecture, and complete the synk pages at the end of each week.

Baldo is a pretty good professor. I hear this class is easy for people who are used to the Bio workload, but I felt this class was overly demanding but you wouldn't know it until after the midterm. The tests are so detailed that you need to go everyday and memorize everything he says. Interesting subject but what you need to memorize is unnecessary

I took this class to satisfy an outside course for Psychology. If you are thinking of doing the same, DON'T. This professor is EXTREMELY smart and knows his stuff, but unless you love the topic or biology in general, it's near impossible to do well. It's 100% necessary to go to every single lecture. His exams are insane, but I'm not a bio major.

He's one of the best professors to go to lecture for... he's hilarious and very informative. His exams are pretty rigorous but with networking and studying old exams of his you should do well. He's a great guy but the class material is a bit dry, in my opinion.

Baldo was an AMAZING teacher. The class is NOT easy, but I'm not paying UCSC tuition to NOT learn. Tests are HARD, you MUST study and prepare for them, but if you do, the questions won't come as a surprise. Best class I've taken in the BIO department.

Attending lecture despite its 8am time is absolutely necessary. There are only two excessively detailed tests, so your performance on both is vital. It's an interesting class and professor, but don't believe it's an easy A---it isn't. It is an easy C.

Amazing and enthusiastic professor. You will love inverts.  It's not an easy subject but he is very helpful and his tests are straight forward and clear.  He is always willing to answer any question and loves people to come to office hours. The book is a great extra resource. You need to come to class!

Pretty much just go to class and take notes, he can be entertaining sometimes. If you go to section and do the worksheets you'll do well on the tests which are pretty much all short answers. There are plenty of extra credit questions as well.

Baldo knows the class topics inside and out. He explains things very clearly and is enthusiastic about teaching. The class is mostly memorization (and lots of it), and tests can get pretty darn detailed, but if you go to lecture, he will tell you everything you need to know for the exams. The book for this course isn't really needed.

He might be a great researcher. No doubt, but as a professor he is just ok. In a big topic such as a ecology and evolution you should have more than 2 tests. Also the guys is all over the place and bot very clear.I don't know if he reads this but he should consider to make more tests on his bio 20 c!
EASY class if you attend lectures, pay attention in them and make sure you understand material. TAs are very helpful too. great professor. and class isnt hard at all.
Easy class if you attend lectures and make sure you understand material.. easy and fun actually. professor was great!!

Baldo is a funny guy, definitely enthusiastic about his topic. I always enjoyed the lectures, but his tests are impossible! I'd never had this much trouble with a test before! It's all memorization, and an incredible amount of content to remember with no guidelines. Don't take this class unless you have to. It's a GPA lower-er.

Great teacher! Lectures seemed clear and concise to me, and if you take good notes, you'll do fine. DO NOT bother buying the textbook, you don't need it at all! Just show up to every lecture and you can do fine on the midterm and final (no cummulative final!)

I don't get what everyone is complaining about. Baldo is amazing. Yougo to class at 8am and he tells you about all the awesome things animals do. That's pretty much it. His tests are easy. The questions are pretty much essentials that you need to know if you want to take any upper div EEB class. Go to lecture and you won't need to read the book.

I loved his class. As long as you go to class and write down everything on his slides you will be fine for the tests. He really knows his stuff and is excited about it. Forget the book i spent $100 and never used it once.

Very good proff. Cracks jokes, lecture is funny and understandable. Attend all lectures cause he bases the tests off solely his notes. Be sure to understand concepts rather than memorizing.  He always wears short shorts and a polo. I believe he has a low curve so be sure to do well. Only a midterm and final and two labs.

Forget the book, go to lecture.  Although the information isn't well organized in his lectures, it's your only tool to get a good grade.  Don't just study the facts either, make sure you learn the CONCEPTS taught because that is what you are tested on.  And I know he's not the best lecturer but the man is hilarious and very nice to look at.

BORING. The tests were pretty hard and he doesn't let you know what grade you have until you find out on your report card. He curves the final grade like crazy. I failed the MT and got a D on the final and managed to get a B as a final grade. Weird.
Really great professor. Lectures are clear and concise. I highly recommend him.

Baldo is my favorite professor. Passing his class with an A- is no joke. I made flashcards for almost every slide and vocab word ever shown in class. But just making the flashcards once really helped me on the exams. They are Short answer and fill in, but also very straight forward. No tricks. Go to him for help if needed. He's really helpful.

Great lecturer, but his exams are ridiculous- all of the questions are long prompt & short answer- it is impossible to know whether you have answered the question completely. Impossible to get an A. Don't take his class.

Baldo was a wonderful professor! He is very helpful and is concerned with his students progress. As long as you have a decent grasp on the material, not just some facts you memorized, getting a good grade in this class is easy.

He cares a lot about his students understanding the concepts. For his tests you have to understand the material to get an A or B not just memorize facts. He makes jokes to make lectures more entertaining on the minus side he eats during office hours and explains things with his mouth full. Overall good teacher but not a super easy class.

Loved this class. Baldo is probably one of the most clear, entertaining, awesome lecturers I've ever had. I loved his teaching style, very straightforward. Go to lecture and you'll do great. He gives review sheets for his midterms that have EVERYTHING you need to know on them, doesn't throw any surprises into the test. GREAT teacher!

Baldo is very entertaining, and was a great delight to have as a professor. To get an A you need to go to class. Also, getting your hands on multiple past exams really helps. He purposely makes the current test different than the previous quarter so getting two quarters prior would help more, but the more tests the better. He's great though!:)

One of the best lectures I've been to at UCSC. His tests are concepts so don't try to memorize the terms. Pay attention in lecture cause he gives examples. He curves ALOT (i wish he didn't though). 72 was average, 55 passing.

Baldo Marinovic is one of the best lecturers at UCSC. His class is an absolute joy! He is a very kind, funny, intelligent individual. Very passionate about the subject and about students understanding. Although some complain about his tests they are actually really easy if you just study his notes. No textbooks

Great professor, and funny. I found his midterm hard because it was based on concepts and not just memorization, but if your TA is decent hopefully he can help. My TA had a thick accent so he was no use...study the slides as much as possible and take good notes on his lectures!

Baldo is a funny guy and his lectures are quite interesting. He tries to make the class fun with cracking jokes. But there is A LOT of material. It's not an easy class and I recommend studying his lecture notes everyday. Memorize all the terms. The midterm was tough but he curves it. The final grade is curved as well.

Amazing class! take it! it is so easy. he curves a lot and yes the evolution part is a bit challenging but the ecology is way easy. i studied the night before the midterm for ecology and got an A oh and no accumulative final
AWESOME professor. Know his material. Lovely sense of humor. Very helpful. Just read his notes and you'll be fine. The exams are from his slides. Good professor overall.

There is 1 midterm and 1 final, quiz each week. Don't wait until the last day to study! After each week go over SYNK pages thoroughly. Take good lecture notes and SYNK notes (save them and study them for the midterm and final) Two exams are not cumulative. This is NOT an easy class. He curves like crazy though :)

Interesting material, good at presenting it clearly. Very enthusiastic and makes attending lecture fun. Don't use the book, all test material is taken from lectures. The material seems easy, but be warned, his tests are all short answer and are quite hard so make sure you understand the concepts not just memorize definitions.
super nice and funny professor. He makes everything so simple. Tests are purposefully written harder. SO STUDY! sections mandatory.

I got an A-. Not a difficult class. Go to lecture or at least try to get notes from a friend bc he doesn't put them online. Pay attention to the examples he has in his slides!! Marinovic, however, I really did not like. He reminds me of a jock whose glory days were high school so he never really grew up. Thank god I have him only for one course.

Overall a pretty cool professor, just attend class, take good notes, study a little every week to ace your section quizzes, and make sure you fully understand your notes before the midterm and final. He tests more on concepts than rote memorization, make sure you can analyze graphs and data too. Don't buy the book, he only tests on his notes.

Baldo's tests test if you can apply ideas to graphs. He doesn't post practice exams, so you wont be able to properly prepare until after your first midterm. The next test is the final. Write down all the power points, oral explanations he gives, and all the examples. Go through the textbook figures and the SYNK pages he posts on his website.

If you find EEB fascinating, be prepared to be disappointed. For such a rich and complex subject, he made it pretty simplistic and uninteresting.  For the tests, memorize his narrow definitions instead of understanding the material. Do not pretend like you know what ecology and evolution are about if your only academic exposure is this course.

Baldo is an awesome teacher, a lot of fun & Inverts is a great class. You need to go to lecture & lab, plus study & do the work to pass. Allison Gong is the hands-down best TA. Everyone I know loved this class.

Great at explaining concepts. Uses good examples that make  the material covered easy to remember. Lectures based on the Freeman text but we were assigned the Brooker text... Make sure you go to class, not everything is in the book. Tests are mainly definitions with little room for variability(keyword based). Would definitely take again. KOBE 4tw!
very clear on his test material, wants students to understand everything. he does, however, have trouble admitting his mistakes which could get confusing at times.

Very funny teacher, I found that his humor helped the concepts stick. Lecture attendance is a must, as tests & hw are solely based on these. I never opened my textbook the entire quarter, and I'm doing pretty well in the class. Highly recommended!

real easy class, dont take it unless ur placed into it tho! baldo is chill and doesnt expect specific detailed analysis of basic biology, he skims the surface of basic material (dont overly study, ull just be pissed after taking a simple test)--the hw was total bs, the TAs want more indetailed answers than what Baldo gives (got to lecture!!)
Tests not based on lectures.  Expects way too much from an intro bio course.  Interesting lectures.

He's pretty much a jerk. Doesn't seem to hold much interest in your academic success at all--he knows you know this, and doesn't seem to mind at all. I tried asking him a question after class and it was pretty obvious he didn't know the answer, so he bullsh*tted me then gave me the brush off. You are really developing the biologist in me, Baldo!

he's a great teacher, you need to really study his notes because he's thorough adn the tests are pretty long, but as  long as you read his notes and the book, but really listen in class, then you should be fine. LISTEN in class because everything he says is on the test. not everything in the book is on the test.

Professor has very difficult time using the phrase "I don't know" and would rather make-up answers instead of admitting a gap in his knowledge (very few animals go through menopause). Bring your textbook and underline every sentence he writes on the board.  Smart and nice, good examples, but his ego trips him up and he loves the sound of his voice.

A great prof for Bio 20C, Summer. His lectures are pretty straight forward, talks really fast. Mixed in a lot of jokes and humor. He interacts with the class a lot; he's really open to questions and his hw is good indication for the exams. 2 MTs, pretty long, short answer (tho he uses MC for big classes). ~60% = passing. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Fun, very interested in his material. Cracks jokes, keeps people interested!

He is SO awesome!  He is very enthusiastic and loves what he does, his class is hard though, but he makes it easy to take!  He expectes alot on the midterms!!  He is all around great teacher, knows his stuff!!

His syllabus shows no grade breakdown so I had to repeatedly ask him what midterms etc were worth.  Changes his mind too much on when exams/trips should be.  His class was fun. He talks too fast and stands in front of the board when you're trying to copy stuff. He labels stuff and doesnt say what it does. my friends got C's and I got B-. study hard

seriously the funniest guy ever to watch in lecture. material was very easy and the tests were simple as well as you went to lecture/did the HW.  very easy going. this class was very early in the morning and i did not need coffee because he was such a character that he woke me up every morning.
No Comments

Baldo is awsome.  He's really into what he teaches so even if it's not your thing, he makes it fun.  He shows up to every lab to help, even though he doesn't have to and takes the class to the tide pools for some actual field IDing.  He gets to know everyone in the class which is impressive and rare.  He's just an overall cool guy.
Baldo is the coolest!  He takes you out to drink at the end of the quarter.  How many of your professors do that?  The class was hard but fun, we got to color pictures and talk about sex.

Excellent prof...makes the material easy to understand.  Tests are just like his homework and notes.  Go to class, take notes, do the homework, and then review your notes and homework...easy A on the tests.
Baldo is awesome. This class is easy. Go to lecture, review your notes, and you should get an A.
hmm this guy seems easy and fun, but ends up being like the rest. Tries really hard to help you, but looks kinda intimidating. Not as easy as I thought it would be.
This teacher THINKS he is hilarious. But his jokes get old. Nonetheless, his analogies are helpful and he's a good lecturer. Be careful on the exams- he's one for details.
He is the best bio teacher one could ever have. He made class very interesting and worthwhile. I was always looking forward to go to class. He is awesome and has a great sense of humor.
an excellent professor.  learned a lot in his class.  exams were not hard as as long as you do the HW assigned.
Very cool teacher. Makes the material fun.
Very funny bio professor. Lectures are easy to understand and exams are okay as long as you study and review your notes. I enjoyed this class!
This teacher uses metaphors as examples to explain biology material. He pokes fun at the students to make learning fun. Great teacher.

awesome bio professor.  I think he should consider replacing some of the bio professors and teach the bio series instead.  This guy really could teach and lays out the materials he expects from his students.
baldo gives great lectures that really keep students entertained.
Very good bio teacher.  His lectures are straight forward and useful for the midterms.  Very reasonable when it comes to grades and wants everyone to pass.
Very good professor! Makes biology easy to understand and fun! Very funny guy! Recommended!
